docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE sweeping changes in Medicare coverage recently signed into law have made some people wonder if they will continue to need ''Medigap'' policies - supplemental insurance provided by private companies that is intended to cover what Medicare does not. While there is some uncertainty about how these companies will redesign their policies in light of the new Medicare Catastrophic Protection

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Responding to the rising demand for new AIDS treatments, the Reagan Administration is preparing a major regulatory proposal to permit faster evaluation of drugs for life-threatening illnesses.

headline.main: U.S. STUDIES WAYS TO SPEED UP DRUGS FOR SERIOUSLY ILL

docs.snippet: LEAD: Responding to the rising demand for new AIDS treatments, the Reagan Administration is preparing a major regulatory proposal to permit faster evaluation of drugs for life-threatening illnesses.

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration ordered its field inspectors today to block imports of dextran sulfate, an unapproved AIDS drug, from a small Canadian company that is promoting the drug to United States customers.

headline.main: U.S. Bans an AIDS Drug From Canada

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration ordered its field inspectors today to block imports of dextran sulfate, an unapproved AIDS drug, from a small Canadian company that is promoting the drug to United States customers.

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times
